meanings.definition: Given or felt by each toward the other; mutual.
meanings.sent1: Their reciprocative friendship was evident in the way they always supported each other.
meanings.sent2: The reciprocative nature of their relationship made it strong and lasting.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to see their reciprocative gestures of kindness towards one another.
meanings.sent4: The reciprocative bond between them was like a sturdy bridge connecting their hearts.
meanings.sent5: The reciprocative love they shared was like a warm blanket on a cold night.

meanings.definition: Acting in a manner that involves give-and-take.
meanings.sent1: She appreciated his reciprocative attitude, always willing to compromise.
meanings.sent2: In negotiations, a reciprocative approach often leads to successful outcomes.
meanings.sent3: Their reciprocative dance on the stage was a joy to watch.
meanings.sent4: The reciprocative rhythm of their conversation was like a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The reciprocative exchange of ideas enriched their collaboration.

meanings.sent1: Their reciprocative efforts led to a fruitful partnership.
meanings.sent2: The reciprocative support they provided each other was invaluable.
meanings.sent3: It was amusing to watch their reciprocative attempts to outdo each other.
meanings.sent4: The reciprocative flow of energy between them was palpable.
meanings.sent5: Their reciprocative teamwork was like a well-oiled machine.
